summary: This document is an email chain from February 2019 discussing a meeting to review a potential sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein. It references a pitch from lawyers representing a victim and mentions Epstein's prior non-prosecution agreement from 2007.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a financier with multiple homes, accused of sex trafficking with dozens of victims, and subject of a prior non-prosecution agreement in 2007.

persons.name: Pete Skinner
persons.context: One of the lawyers who pitched a sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein earlier in the week referenced in the email.

connections.description: Skinner is described as a lawyer who pitched a sex trafficking case against Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's non-prosecution agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered into a non-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Lawyer pitch on Epstein case
events.description: Earlier in the week of the email, Pete Skinner and two other lawyers pitched a sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: Lawyers, including Pete Skinner, pitched a sex trafficking case against Jeffrey Epstein to the U.S. Attorney's Office in early 2019.
The case involved a victim who claims to have been prostituted by Epstein when she was 16 years old.
Epstein was described as having dozens of victims, with unclear timelines on when his criminal conduct stopped.
Epstein had a prior non-prosecution agreement with the Southern District of Florida U.S. Attorney's Office from 2007.
The email chain indicates internal discussion and interest within the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding pursuing the case.
